intro: Erigeron tianschanicus, commonly known as the Tian Shan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk. Erigeron tianschanicus is often found in open habitats and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its native range.
